intro: Campanula persicifolia var. subpyrenaica, commonly known as the Pyrenean bellflower, is a perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of the Iberian Peninsula. It features showy, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine settings. Its ornamental value and adaptability contribute to its appeal among horticulturists and gardeners.
